Class QuickSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • QuickSort

  • public class QuickSort
extends java.lang.Object
    This QuickSort class was borrowed in large part from the following source: â€œQuickSort - GeeksforGeeks.â€� The median-of-three method was found here: "Quick Sort with Median-of-Three Partitioning: Sort < Collections < Java Tutorial." This class is not an exact copy of these sources, however, as personal contributions have been made to fit the requirements of this project. The standard quicksort method was altered to work with a pivot at the first element. The 100 and 50 quicksort methods were based on the first quicksort method after its alteration.
    Author:
    arta

      • firstPartition

        public int firstPartition(int[] arr,
                          int low,
                          int high)
        "Select the first item of the partition as the pivot. Treat partitions of size one and two as stopping cases."
        Parameters:
        arr - Array being sorted
        low - Low index of array/partition
        high - High index of array/partition
        Returns:
        Pivot index

      • oneHundPart

        public int oneHundPart(int[] arr,
                       int low,
                       int high)
        "Select the first item of the partition as the pivot. Treat a partition of size 100 as a stopping case. Use an insertion sort to finish."
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to be sorted
        low - Lowest index of array/partition
        high - Highest index of array/partition
        Returns:
        Pivot index

      • fiddyPart

        public int fiddyPart(int[] arr,
                     int low,
                     int high)
        "Select the first item of the partition as the pivot. Treat a partition of size 50 as a stopping case. Use an insertion sort to finish."
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to be sorted
        low - Lowest index of array/partition
        high - Highest index of array/partition
        Returns:
        Pivot index

      • sort

        public void sort(int[] arr,
                 int low,
                 int high,
                 int sortKind)
        "The main function that implements QuickSort() arr[] --> Array to be sorted, low --> Starting index, high --> Ending index"
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to be sorted
        low - Element at the bottom of partition
        high - Element at the top of partition
        sortKind - Type of quicksort that will be done on arr

      • printArray

        public void printArray(int[] arr,
                       java.lang.String fileName,
                       int sortType,
                       long elapsedTime)
        Prints entire array as well as sort type, elapsed time in nanoseconds and data file name to std out
        Parameters:
        arr - Sorted array
        fileName - Name of data file
        sortType - Type of quicksort
        elapsedTime - Time in nanoseconds of sort
